CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is living in GPE , where he is a farmer and owner of the PERSON alp . According to a regulatory deed ( PERSON ) of DATE concerning the alp , the owner of this alp is entitled to obtain timber from ORG to the extent necessary for the maintenance of the alp 's cabins .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG as the agricultural authority of first instance ( PERSON erster PERSON - “ the ORG ” ) to grant him the necessary quantity of timber for the maintenance of existing and the edification of new alpine cabins .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing and on DATE a forestry expert delivered his opinion .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave its decision , ordering ORG to provide the applicant with a certain quantity of timber within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Landesagrarsenat - “ the Regional Board ” ) dismissed the appeal and ordered ORG to provide the applicant with a smaller quantity of timber within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint against this decision with ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant 's appeal of CARDINAL DATE and referred the case back to ORG .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE ORG opened supplementary proceedings with a view to amending the regulatory deed of DATE concerning the alp . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE hearings were held . On DATE an agricultural expert delivered his opinion as to the average annual timber supply necessary for the maintenance of the cabins .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision , by which it amended the regulatory deed of DATE and determined the provision of timber for the owner of the PERSON alp . The applicant appealed against this decision , claiming that a fixed annual supply of timber should be granted irrespective of the need to maintain the cabins .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly granted the appeal and amended ORG decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant 's request for leave to appeal out of time ( Wiedereinsetzung in den vorigen Stand ) to ORG ( ORG - “ the ORG ” ) against ORG decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , after having held a hearing , dismissed the applicant 's further appeal . It found that the legal instrument of DATE only conferred a right to obtain timber for the maintenance of cabins , not a right to a fixed annual quantity of timber .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to deal with the complaint for lack of sufficient prospects of success and remitted the case to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint . It confirmed that the applicant was entitled to obtain a variable quantity of timber dependent on the need to maintain his alp 's cabins , but not to obtain a fixed annual quantity . The decision was served on the applicant 's counsel on DATE .
